translations.translation: for beggars and the destitute;
For the needy and those dispossessed,
for those that ask and those that are dispossessed,
for the needy and the deprived,
For those who beg, and for the needy who cannot even ask.
For the one who asks, and for the deprived.
For him who begs and for him who is denied (good)
for the beggar and the outcast,
For the beggar and the destitute;
to those who ask [for help] and to the destitute;
For the beggar and the destitute.
for the beggar and the deprived,
For the (needy) who asks and him who is prevented (for some reason from asking);
For the beggar who asks, and for the unlucky who has lost his property and wealth, (and his means of living has been straitened);
for the impoverished nonrequester and the requester,
For the beggar and the deprived.
For the petitioner and the deprived -
[70:25] for the beggar and the deprived, the [latter being the] one who refrains from begging and thus becomes deprived,

(For the beggar) who ask you to give him from your wealth (and the destitute) who is denied his wage or booty; it is also said that this refers to the artisan whose skill does not earn him enough for him to subsist; it is also said that this refers to the poor who does not beg from others and as a result no one gives or knows about him;

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text: وقوله تعالى: { لِّلسَّآئِلِ وَٱلْمَحْرُومِ } معناه صاحبُ الحِرفةِ الذي لَيسَ لَهُ في الإِسلامِ سَهمٌ

translations.translation: And His saying, {for the asker and the deprived} [means] the owner of the [letter of] divorce who has no share in Islam.

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text:
{ لِّلسَّآئِلِ } الذي يسأل ويفشي فقره { وَٱلْمَحْرُومِ } [المعارج: 25] الذي لا يسأل ولا يفشي
 بل من كمال صيانته وتحفظه واستغنائه يُحسب من الأغنياء من كمال التعفف لذلك يحرم
